intro: Pentapterygium listeri, commonly known as the Hawaiian fern tree, is a flowering plant native to the island of Hawaii. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palm-like appearance with compound leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or reddish in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in coastal areas and rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
